caption: I love ile saint denis, and this church is pretty quaint and calm, even the architecture is much calmer than other churches and cathedrals in paris. Nice place to quickly visit while touring the island.

Just happened upon this on a walkabout in Paris.  Not as opulent as some cathedrals and in need of some touch ups, but overall still very beautiful and worth popping I to.   I was lucky to enter when there was a choir practice.  Great audio.
Music was correct and majestic. Just great! Look at the details. Otherwise the church is not that huge in comparison with the other known churches in Paris.

St. Louis (Église Saint-Louis-en-l'Île) is an early 18th-century church on the island in the middle of the Seine River. It features both Baroque and Classical architecture and is open from 9.30-1pm and 2-7.30pm (Mon-Sat) and 9-1pm and 2-7pm (Sun).  The exterior is very simple, doesn't stand out from other buildings along Rue Saint-Louis with the exception of the bell tower with a hanging clock helps give away the presence of a church.  Once inside, a much larger than anticipated interior presents itself. The nave includes columns and ceiling with nice gilding and stucco ornamentation. Stained-glass windows behind an attractive main altar and altarpiece make for nice sightseeing.  The aisles and area behind the main altar include smaller chapels with impressive frescos. However, these areas receive much less natural light so are more difficult to view properly. Historic artworks by Fra Angelico, Coypel and Carle Van Loo can be viewed within these chapels as well.  Overall, we like Église Saint-Louis-en-l'Île. It is a nice church with a few really nice artworks to see. If you are planning to be on the island or if you simply like visiting historic churches, this is a good place to include in your sightseeing itinerary.
Amazing church currently under renovation, but still worth a look.
A beautiful parish church and one of the oldest in Paris - some magnificent stained glass windows. A quiet place to contemplate.
Lovely church. Wonderful  family oriented mass with lots of kids. Very reverend service.  I went to a Vivaldi concert offered there on the Sunday evening we were in Paris.
Amazing nice little church, an architectural treasure. Be careful when visiting; it’s a religious place and sometimes there are ceremonies.

An oasis of calm and beauty in the chaos of tourist terror. Romanesque architecture but still light and airy. The back wall is plastered with posters proclaiming upcoming concerts in a space of wonderful acoustics. Renovations ongoing but don’t let that put you off.
Magnificent glass in lead windows. Beautiful church.

Although Notre Dame was under reconstruction, they did an incredible job of documentation.  Many features highlighted every specialty of skilled workers, from architects to welders. Beautiful tribute.
A small hidden gem on St. Louis' Island. Of note, the church is currently being renovated.
Very nice bell tower with holes. Sometimes good sacred shows.
Beautiful church in the Heart of Saint Louis island
Restauration work in progress: pay attention to some huge paintings and many details all around the church: I strongly advise to get a look when natural light will put emphasis to the hidden beauties

The whole Île de Saint Louis is my favorite place in Paris. This church is very charming (and small)  and have regular concerts (like most churches in Paris). Built around the end of XVII century, it has some nice paintings and stained glasses.
The tag is not on the right building. The church is beautiful. During summer solstice you can witness an amazing solar moment on the street outside.
Beautiful church, open and still looking good despite under going renovations at the minute. I love the peaceful calm inside churches, worth sparing a quiet moment for a visit here
A cool refuge on a hot summer's day.
Attended mass here, no problems getting in. Entire mass was in french so I didn't understand anything but the the people were friendly
My favourite Church in Paris. Even while undergoing renovations, the parish is alive and vibrant.
This is one of the oldest churches in Paris here on this island, which is one of the longest-inhabited areas of Paris - meaning back to the 13th c. and beyond.
Plenty of quaint shops. They're not too touristy, although I doubt you'll get value for money here.
Beautiful
Beautiful Church amazing stain glass windows and stunning statues.
Pricy at the cafés so be warned but not so crowded and has some lovely little shops.
Beautiful interior
A very pretty and peaceful place. A quiet moment in a bustling city.
Looooove this island and this church. Now in renovation but still worth seeing
Excellent !
Always a pleasure to listen to a concert in this church
A beautiful All Saints’ Day service
Beautiful church with a lovely organ.
Recently restored 😍 …
A small gem of a church in the heart of Paris.
Absolutely amazing interior deco.
Very nice church
Unbelievable beautiful place
